head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: Conviction In Police Officer's Shooting

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Law Enforcement and Security

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: Conviction In Police Officer's Shooting

abstract.p: Lasana Philbert is convicted of assault in New York State Supreme Court in New York City for wounding Police Officer Christopher Wiesneski in 2005 during struggle for Wiesneski's gun (S)

block.p: Lasana Philbert, 23, has been convicted in State Supreme Court of assault on a police officer for wounding Officer Christopher Wiesneski in 2005 by grabbing his gun during a struggle, causing it to fire, the Queens district attorney, Richard A. Brown, said yesterday. Prosecutors said that Officer Wiesneski had to retire as a result of his wound. Mr. Philbert, of Cambria Heights, faces up to 15 years in prison when he is sentenced next month, Mr. Brown said.

Brown, said yesterday. Prosecutors said that Officer Wiesneski had to retire as a result of his wound.
